section_details.title: Listening Part 2: Detail Comprehension
section_details.instructions_de: Sie hören nun ein Gespräch. Dazu sollen Sie zehn Aufgaben lösen. Sie hören das Gespräch nur einmal. Entscheiden Sie beim Hören, ob die Aussagen 46-55 richtig oder falsch sind. Markieren Sie Ihre Lösungen auf dem Antwortbogen bei den Aufgaben 46-55. Markieren Sie PLUS (+) gleich richtig und MINUS (–) gleich falsch auf dem Antwortbogen. Lesen Sie jetzt die Aufgaben 46-55. Sie haben dazu eine Minute Zeit.
section_details.instructions_en: You will now hear a conversation. You should solve ten tasks. You will hear the conversation only once. Decide while listening whether the statements 46-55 are correct or false. Mark your solutions on the answer sheet at tasks 46-55. Mark PLUS (+) as correct and MINUS (–) as false on the answer sheet. Read now the tasks 46-55. You have one minute to do this.
section_details.instructions_ar: ستسمع الآن حوارًا. يجب أن تحل عشرة عمليات. ستسمع الحوار فقط مرة واحدة. قرر أثناء الاستماع إذا كانت البيانات 46-55 صحيحة أو خاطئة. حدد حلولك على ورقة الإجابة عند المهام 46-55. حدد PLUS (+) كصحيح و MINUS (–) كخاطئ على ورقة الإجابة. قرأ الآن المهام 46-55. لديك دقيقة لفعل هذا.
section_details.instructions_ru: Вы сейчас услышите разговор. Вы должны решить десять задач. Вы услышите разговор только один раз. Решите, слушая, являются ли утверждения 46-55 правильными или неправильными. Отметьте свои решения на листе ответов на задачи 46-55. Отметьте PLUS (+) как правильное и MINUS (–) как неправильное на листе ответов. Прочитайте теперь задачи 46-55. У вас есть одна минута, чтобы сделать это.
section_details.instructions_fr: Vous entendrez maintenant une conversation. Vous devez résoudre dix tâches. Vous entendrez la conversation une seule fois. Décidez en écoutant si les affirmations 46-55 sont correctes ou incorrectes. Marquez vos solutions sur le formulaire de réponses aux tâches 46-55. Marquez PLUS (+) comme correct et MINUS (–) comme incorrect sur le formulaire de réponses. Lisez maintenant les tâches 46-55. Vous avez une minute pour faire cela.
section_details.instructions_es: Escucharás ahora una conversación. Debes resolver diez tareas. Escucharás la conversación una sola vez. Decide mientras escuchas si las afirmaciones 46-55 son correctas o incorrectas. Marca tus soluciones en el formulario de respuestas en las tareas 46-55. Marca PLUS (+) como correcto y MINUS (–) como incorrecto en el formulario de respuestas. Lee ahora las tareas 46-55. Tienes un minuto para hacer esto.

statements.statement: The new study suggests that the digital nomad lifestyle is exactly as enjoyable as it looks on social media.
According to Dr. Bennett, the most difficult challenge for nomads is finding a reliable internet connection.
Digital nomads often struggle to make long-term friends because they move location frequently.
Employers are currently very concerned that their remote workers are lazy and not working enough hours.
A major risk for remote workers is burnout caused by an inability to stop working at the end of the day.
The arrival of wealthy foreign workers often causes rent and food prices to increase for local residents.
Local residents in popular destinations generally welcome the changes brought by digital nomads without complaint.
Most countries allow tourists to work remotely on a standard tourist visa without any legal issues.
Some governments are introducing specific visas to clarify the tax and legal status of remote workers.
The majority of digital nomads are currently young people in their twenties with low incomes.
According to Mark, the increase in bicycle sales has led to a significant drop in rush hour car traffic.
Mark suggests that most people currently use their new bikes for recreational purposes rather than commuting.
The guest believes that painted lines on roads are insufficient to make cyclists feel safe.
Mark agrees with the host that the British weather is a valid reason for low cycling rates.
According to the interview, electric bikes have effectively removed the difficulty of cycling in hilly cities.
Shop owners are often initially worried that cycle lanes will negatively affect their business.
Data shows that car drivers spend more money in local shops than cyclists do.
Mark claims that road aggression is entirely the fault of car drivers.
The guest suggests that conflict arises because different road users are competing for the same space.
The proposed solution to road rage is to separate the physical paths of cars and bicycles.
According to the guest, the trend of working remotely from abroad is currently declining.
Digital nomads are currently almost exclusively young freelancers and tech entrepreneurs.
Local residents in some popular destinations have protested against the influx of remote workers.
Dr. Thorne suggests that digital nomads contribute to rising housing costs in the cities they visit.
Landlords generally prefer renting to local families because they stay for longer periods.
Research indicates that loneliness is a significant problem for long-term digital nomads.
Companies are generally unhappy about remote work because it increases their office costs.
Managers are concerned that remote work makes mentoring younger employees more difficult.
Dr. Thorne believes that the 'hybrid' working model will disappear in the near future.
Some countries are introducing specific visas to regulate remote workers and taxation.
